subject: Marketing
title: Shock Advertising
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Shock Advertising.

hook.text: Benetton ran an ad showing a dying AIDS patient surrounded by his weeping family.

buildup.text: Shock advertising deliberately provokes to break through the noise.

discovery.text: It works because outrage is the most viral emotion. People share what disturbs them.

twist.text: But shock fades fast. Each campaign must escalate to get the same reaction.

climax.text: Benetton got attention but lost retailers who refused to stock a 'controversial' brand.

punchline.text: Shock gets attention. The question is what comes after.

quiz.question: What is the main risk of shock advertising?
options: Each campaign must escalate, and partners may distance themselves
It never generates any media attention
Consumers always respond positively to shocking content
